intro: Androcorys josephi, commonly known as the Joseph's androcorys, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, glossy surface. Androcorys josephi is often found in moist, rocky habitats at high elevations.
